content.value_statement: Build world-class computer vision AI systems with expert-level guidance on model training, optimization, and production deployment. This skill provides ready-to-use Python tools and comprehensive reference architectures for vision AI projects.
actual_capabilities: Train custom vision models using PyTorch with transfer learning
Optimize inference pipelines for production deployment
Implement object detection with YOLO and Faster R-CNN
Apply semantic segmentation for pixel-level understanding
Deploy vision models with Docker and Kubernetes
limitations: Requires existing PyTorch or OpenCV environment setup
Does not provide pre-trained model weights or datasets
Focuses on 2D vision; 3D reconstruction requires additional tools
Cloud infrastructure costs managed separately by user

prompt_templates.title: Train detection model
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me train a custom YOLO object detection model. I have labeled images in a dataset and need to configure training parameters, apply transfer learning from a pretrained checkpoint, and evaluate the model performance.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize inference
prompt_templates.prompt: My vision model has 200ms inference latency. Analyze the model architecture and suggest optimization strategies including quantization, batching, and TensorRT acceleration to achieve under 50ms P99 latency.

prompt_templates.title: Build pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a distributed dataset pipeline for processing 100k images per day. Include data augmentation, validation checks, and parallel processing across multiple workers.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy vision service
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete deployment configuration for my vision model including Docker container, Kubernetes deployment with auto-scaling, health endpoints, and monitoring with Prometheus metrics.

output_examples.input: How do I set up a vision pipeline for real-time video analysis?
output: ‚Üí Configure video frame extraction with OpenCV at target FPS

‚Üí Apply batch processing for GPU efficiency (batch size 8-16 recommended)
‚Üí Use async inference to maintain pipeline throughput

output_examples.input: What optimization techniques reduce vision model size by 75%?
output: ‚Üí INT8 post-training quantization (4x reduction with <1% accuracy loss)
‚Üí Prune convolutional filters with <0.01 importance score
‚Üí Apply knowledge distillation from full model to smaller architecture
‚Üí Use ONNX export with TensorRT optimization for NVIDIA GPUs

best_practices: Always validate input images for corrupt files and proper dimensions before inference
Use transfer learning from verified checkpoints rather than training from scratch
Implement model versioning and rollback capabilities for production deployments
anti_patterns: Deploying models without input validation or rate limiting
Ignoring model drift detection in production vision systems
Using single-batch inference when batching can improve throughput 5-10x

faq.question: What vision models does this skill support?
faq.answer: YOLO (all versions), Faster R-CNN, Mask R-CNN, Vision Transformers, Segment Anything Model (SAM), and U-Net.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with cloud GPUs?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with any PyTorch-compatible GPU including AWS, GCP, Azure, and dedicated GPU servers.

faq.question: Does this skill include pre-trained models?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides training and deployment tools. You load pretrained weights from official model hubs.

faq.question: What output formats are supported for deployment?
faq.answer: TorchScript, ONNX, TensorRT engine, and Triton Inference Server format are all supported.

faq.question: Can I run real-time video analysis with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes video processing patterns for frame extraction, batching, and async inference.

faq.question: Does this skill handle model versioning?
faq.answer: The skill provides deployment configurations but model versioning requires MLflow or Weights & Biases integration.
